title: Adrian Augier
text:
Adrian Augier is a St. Lucian poet and producer. His writings and productions center on life in <a href="Saint%20Lucia">St. Lucia</a> and have been featured throughout the country, earning widespread acclaim.
Career.
Augier co-founded the Lighthouse Theater and the Factor Creative Arts Centre, both in St. Lucia. He is also director of the St. Lucia Arts Festival Company.
In honor of the 25th and 30th anniversaries of <a href="Independence%20of%20Saint%20Lucia">St. Lucia's independence</a>, in 2004 and 2009 respectively, he wrote and produced the shows "Anthem" and "Esperance" which made national headlines.
His latest publication "Navel String" encompasses St. Lucian life, culture, and politics.
He has had multiple poetry anthologies published, and has written musicals including the "Hewanorra Story" and "Troumassay".
In addition to a careers in business and the arts, he performed music globally with his band, Rituals, in the early 2000s.
He has been recognized as having made outstanding contributions to <a href="Caribbean">Caribbean</a> arts.
Augier also has a background in <a href="economics">economics</a>. He is a sitting <a href="Senate%20of%20Saint%20Lucia">senator</a> of St. Lucia, formerly Chief Economist in St. Lucia's Ministry of Finance and Planning. He has contributed to economic discussion in his home country, the <a href="World%20Bank">World Bank</a>, <a href="European%20Union">European Union</a>, and the <a href="United%20Nations">United Nations</a>, among others. He was also co-chair of the <a href="Caricom">CARICOM</a> Task Force on the Development of Cultural Industries, and he was St. Lucia's 2010 Entrepreneur of the Year.
Education.
Augier received his BA in economics and political science at the <a href="University%20of%20Western%20Ontario">University of Western Ontario</a>, later earning a master's in development finance and planning from <a href="American%20University">American University</a>.
In 2012 Augier received an honorary degree from the <a href="University%20of%20the%20West%20Indies">University of the West Indies</a> that recognized his contributions to the arts and economics in the Caribbean.
Personal life.
Born in 1959, Augier is married with 3 children and currently lives in St. Lucia.
His son <a href="Jordan%20Augier">Jordan Augier</a> swam for St. Lucia in the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a> after graduating from the <a href="University%20of%20Tampa">University of Tampa</a> .
